intro: Pleurothallis bertoniensis, commonly known as the Bertoni's orchid, is a species native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a small epiphytic orchid, typically growing on tree branches or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
